thread.title: Suspect held over death of jogger sexually assaulted and strangled 'after DNA links him to scene'
thread.title_full: Suspect held over death of jogger sexually assaulted and strangled 'after DNA links him to scene'

author: Natalie Evans
title: Suspect held over death of jogger sexually assaulted and strangled 'after DNA links him to scene'
text:
News Suspect held over death of jogger sexually assaulted and strangled 'after DNA links him to scene' Avid runner Karina Vetrano, 30, was found dead in a park in Queens, New York, in August last year Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
A man has been arrested in connection with the death of a jogger who was snatched from the street and strangled to death. 
Karina Vetrano, 30, was found dead in a New York park in August last year. 
Police believe she was punched in the face before being dragged into the park, sexually assaulted and strangled in the Howard Beach area of Queens. 
A suspect was held on Saturday night at an address in Brooklyn, NBC New York reported. 
No charged have been filed and no details of the individual have been released, however sources told the New York Post the man is in his 20s and lives in Brooklyn. 
He is believed to have been held after DNA linked him to the scene, the Post reported. Read More Karina Vetrano's last moments were captured on CCTV (Photo: Daily Crime Watch) Karina was punched in the face before being sexually assaulted and strangled (Photo: Facebook) 
Haunting images of Karina's last moments were caught on CCTV before she abducted. 
The keen runner was found dead just five hours after the surveillance photo was captured at around 5.46pm on Tuesday August 2. 
NYPD Chief of Detectives Robert Boyce told TV show Crime Watch Daily she had been subjected to a horrific ordeal. 
He said: "She was punched in the teeth. Karina Vetrano was killed after going for a run last month (Photo: jeteyess/instagram) 
"She also had bruising on her body, we believe from being dragged through those woods. 
"She had stems of weeds in her hands. She fought not to go into those weeds." 
Her body was discovered by her dad Philip after worried family and friends launched a search when she didn't arrive home. Read More Missing teenager 'is pregnant with ex-boyfriend's baby' and best friend claims her 'head is in a mess' Father Philip Vetrano found his daughter's body (Photo: staceysager7/instagram) 
DNA evidence was found on Karina's body but no match has been found on the national DNA database. 
Philip, a former firefighter, said: "I got a feeling, it came over me. She was talking to me then and I got off that couch and I went looking for her." 
Mum Cathy added: "I am a very forgiving person. I believe in the lord. I believe in beautiful things. And I will never ever, ever, ever, ever forgive.‚Äù Like us on Facebook
